column4: I need some help networking.  I can see my router and whole network, but can't get online.
have you checked the dns?
are you using linux for a router?  or is it a wireless router or something/
ok, did you check dns? try 'cat /etc/resolv.conf'
is there line in there that says 'nameserver' with an IP address?
cat /etc/resolv.conf returned one line and it was commented out
yeah, you don't have a DNS server specified, did you manually assign the IP address
yeah, trying to get ssh working.  what should I do to get my DNS working?
the easiest way is to set it in System -> Administration -> Network
I tried looking in there a few times... I didn't see anything that sounded like gateway or dns
fine, just edit resolv.conf to get it working for now; make sure that's the problem
gimme a sec.
no problem
nameserver 208.67.222.222
that's opendns, it's safe
so that worked.. am I going to have to do that every time I restart?
yes, until you set it in the Gnome Network Manger thing, or in /etc/network/interfaces
what line should I add to my /etc/network/interfaces file?
use dns-nameservers
i.e. in the section for the interface for the internet, which should have been set up already w/ the address/netmask/gateway, add the line 'dns-nameservers 208.67.222.222'
here's where i found your answer, if you want to read more: http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/reference/ch-gateway.en.html
thanks-you've been a big help.
